html:
Verb[edit]

iacuissētis

  1. second-person plural pluperfect active subjunctive of iaceō
    1. "you would have lain prostrate, you would have lain down; you would have reclined"
    2. "you would have lain ill, you would have been sick"
    3. "you would have lingered, you would have tarried"
    4. "you would have been placed or situated, you would have lain"
    5. "you would have been low, flat or level"
    6. "you would have lain still"
    7. "you would have lain dead"
    8. "you would have lain in ruins"
    9. "you would have hung down loose"
    10. (of the face or eyes) "you would have been fixed on the ground, you would have been cast down"
    11. "you would have been indolent, idle or inactive"
    12. "you would have lain dormant or abandoned, you would have been of no avail"
    13. "you would have lain overthrown; you would have been refuted; you would have been despised"
    14. (of speech or language) "you would have been languid, dull or lifeless"
